text:
Rosalind P. Walter (born "née" Palmer; June 25, 1924 – March 4, 2020) was an American philanthropist and humanitarian. She was best known for her late 20th and early 21st-century support for public television programming across the United States.
During World War II, she also inspired the creation of "Rosie the Riveter", who was named after her.
Rosie died in her home in Manhattan on March 4, 2020 at the age of 95.
